metadata.title: CVE-2022-1419 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The root cause of this vulnerability is that theioctl$DRM_IOCTL_MODE_DESTROY_DUMB can decrease refcount of*drm_vgem_gem_object *(created in *vgem_gem_dumb_create*) concurrently, and*vgem_gem_dumb_create *will access the freed drm_vgem_gem_object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1419` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.115
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-229.263~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.115').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
